intro: Cytisogenista scoparia var. oxyphylla, commonly known as the oxyphyll cytisogenista, is a variant of the cytisogenista scoparia species. It is a flowering plant characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats, preferring well-drained soils and full sun exposure. Its leaves are trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. This variant is notable for its distinct floral characteristics and adaptability to arid environments.
